business.headline: Why zero GST on insurance premiums doesn't mean cheaper policies for youOn the surface, removing GST on insurance premiums seems like a big relief, but experts caution that the outcome may not be what many are expecting.

EPFO withdrawal, pension or transfer: How to choose the right PF formEPFO members often get confused about which form to fill for withdrawals, transfers, or pension claims. Using the right form not only saves time but also avoids delays or rejection of your application.

CA explains why 80% of emergency funds don't work when neededMost people believe they are financially prepared for tough times, but when a real crisis hits, their so-called emergency funds often fall short. A chartered accountant explains why this happens and how to fix it.

Online Gaming Bill 2025: What are the different penalties in it?The Bill, which was passed in the Lok Sabha soon after it was introduced, focusses on reducing risks linked to addiction, money laundering, and misleading advertising.

No GST on life, health insurance premiums soon? Here's what it means for youA proposal has been made to exempt premiums for life and health insurance from Goods and Services Tax (GST), a move that could bring down costs and boost insurance penetration.
Sensex opens 150 points higher, Nifty above 25,000; RIL gains 1%The S&P BSE Sensex added 122.01 points to 81,979.85, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 20.45 points to 25,071.00 as of 9:23 am.

4 IPOs to close for bidding today: Which one will give you best listing gains?All four IPOs opened for subscription on August 19 and will complete allotment on August 22. The listing of these companies is scheduled for August 26 on the BSE and NSE.

Now you can buy land via a mobile app in minutes. Here's howThe initiative is intended to make land purchases easier, quicker and more transparent by using a platform that millions already rely on for daily shopping.

Will next-gen GST make homes more affordable?With the government considering a simpler two-slab GST structure, many are asking a key question: Will the new system finally make home buying more affordable?

Rapido fined Rs 10 lakh over false ads, regulator orders refunds to consumersThe penalty follows complaints that Rapido's ads such as "Guaranteed Auto" and "Auto in 5 min or get Rs 50" misled customers by creating the impression of guaranteed services.
Sensex ends 213 points higher, Nifty above 25,000; Infosys up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 213.45 points to close at 81,857.84, while the NSE Nifty50 added 69.90 points to end at 25,050.55.

CA explains the risks behind 'No EMI till possession' schemesMany homebuyers are lured by "No EMI Till Possession" schemes, but a chartered accountant warns that these offers can carry hidden financial risks that may leave buyers paying for a property they never receive.

Indian-state run refiners resume Russian oil purchase amid tariff threats: ReportThe resumption of Russian oil imports by Indian state refiners could reduce supplies for top buyer China, which had stepped up purchases during their absence.

Labubu mania is back as Pop Mart shares rise by 11%, CEO predicts record salesPop Mart reported a 204% rise in revenue to 13.88 billion yuan for the first half of 2025, beating the average analyst estimate of 13.76 billion yuan. Net income jumped 397% to 4.57 billion yuan, highlighting the company's rapid growth.

Online gaming bill: Nazara Technologies and Delta Corp shares take a hitThe bill, which proposes strict rules for money-based online games and makes online betting a punishable offence, is expected to be tabled in the Lok Sabha later today.

Shifted to new tax regime? Here are 5 investments you shouldn't dropAlthough the new regime comes with lower tax rates and no exemptions, several traditional investment products continue to play a vital role in securing your finances and growing long-term wealth.

US targets Indian refiners, says richest families made excess profitsThe criticism from US is focused on India's private refiners, particularly Reliance Industries and Nayara Energy, which together account for a large share of refined fuel exports to Europe.

Ola Electric shares jump 13%, up over 20% in two sessions. Should you buy?On Tuesday, the stock climbed almost sharply after founder and chairman Bhavish Aggarwal outlined an aggressive strategy to reclaim market share and improve profitability in India's competitive EV segment.

Sensex, Nifty open lower as financial stocks offset IT gains in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 125.67 points to 81,518.72, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 34.50 points to 24,946.15 as of 9:33 am.

Game over for money-based online gaming? Industry in shock over proposed banIf passed in Parliament, the bill will outlaw all money-based online games (irrespective of whether they involve skill or chance), ban advertisements promoting such platforms, and bar banks and financial institutions from processing related transactions.

Death knell for industry: Gaming body writes to Amit Shah on money-based gaming banIn its communication, the All India Gaming Federation stressed the need for "progressive regulation" rather than outright prohibition, highlighting the potential fallout for millions of players and the broader industry.

Centre to ban all money-based gaming transactions under new bill: SourcesUnder the proposed Regulation & Promotion of Online Gaming Act, banks and financial institutions will not be allowed to process or transfer funds for real-money online games.

Sensex, Nifty close higher on GST buzz, easing global tensionsThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 370.64 points, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 103.70 points to settle at 24,980.65. Broader markets also ended in the green, with mid- and small-cap stocks outperforming.

PM Viksit Bharat Rozgar Yojana: Who can get Rs 15,000 and other benefitsFirst-time employees under Part A can receive a one-time incentive equal to about one month's basic pay, up to Rs 15,000, paid in two instalments.

Two retirees, Rs 2 crore each, yet one runs out of money early. CA explains whyTwo retirees may have the same Rs 2 crore in savings, but their financial journeys can differ drastically. A CA explains how market timing and sequencing risk can decide who runs out of money first.

Are next-gen GST reforms a done deal?The next-gen GST overhaul could redefine India's tax landscape, but consensus among states and revenue concerns will decide its fate. For now, GST 2.0 is a promise, not a done deal. Read to know why.

ITR-U explained: Check eligibility, deadline, and penalties for updated returnsThe Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) has made it simpler for taxpayers to correct errors in their income tax returns through the updated ITR-U. Here's a guide on who can file, the deadline, and possible penalties.

Why you should wait until October for big purchases, explains expertIf you've been planning to buy a car, air conditioner, or other expensive items, it might be wise to hold off for a few weeks. Expert says waiting until October could save you money thanks to upcoming GST reforms.

Why lower GST is better for your wallet than income tax reliefUnlike income tax, which applies only to those earning above a certain threshold, GST is an indirect tax levied on almost every transaction, covering nearly everything you buy.
How the SCL fire in Mohali sabotaged India's chip dreamsThe blaze caused losses estimated at Rs 75 crore in 1989, but the true cost the nation would pay would be known decades later.

Explained: Why Ola Electric shares rose 7% in early tradeOla Electric's rising share price appears to be a result of renewed investor optimism, driven by the company's ambitious EV targets and gigafactory plans, but sustaining momentum will depend on market share recovery.

Sensex, Nifty gain as GST reforms buzz keeps investor sentiment bullishAt 9:21 am, the S&P BSE Sensex climbed 150.78 points to 81,424.53, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 38.15 points to 24,915.10. Most broader market indices also traded in the green during early deals, indicating improved investor sentiment.

Next-generation GST reforms will reduce tax burden, boost growth: CEAChief Economic Advisor Dr. V Anantha Nageshwaran said the GST overhaul, coupled with earlier tax cuts, will lower consumer costs, ease inflation, and boost disposable incomes, calling it a transformative step in India's eight-year tax reform journey

Received a fake income tax call? Key warning signs and tips to protect yourselfScammers are increasingly posing as income tax officials to trick people into sharing personal and financial information. If you receive a suspicious call during the filing season, it's important to stay calm and know the warning signs before taking any action.

India's job market shows relief as unemployment rate falls to 5.2% in JulyThe jobless rate in rural areas for people aged 15 years and above fell to 4.4% in July from 4.9% in June. Seasonal demand for workers in agriculture and related activities supported this improvement.

Apple rents 2.7 lakh sq ft in Bengaluru, costing Rs 1,000 crore over a decadeThe lease covers nine floors, from the 5th to the 13th floor, in the Embassy Zenith building. Apple has also made a security deposit of Rs 31.57 crore.

Want quicker PF access? Here are the updated EPFO rulesUnder the updated rules, if your name, gender and date of birth match in both Aadhaar and UAN records, you no longer need EPFO approval to link the two.
Sensex ends 676 points higher, Nifty above 24,800; Maruti gains 9%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 676.09 points to end at 81,273.75, while the NSE Nifty50 added 245.65 points to close at 24,876.95.
GST bonanza before festive rush? Here's what it could mean for youThe biggest change for middle-class families could be in aspirational goods such as televisions, refrigerators, and washing machines.

Crorepati on paper, cash-poor in reality? CA explains why liquidity matters moreA high net worth can be misleading if most of your wealth is tied up in property or long-term investments. An expert believes that true financial security comes from having liquid assets that can be accessed at short notice.

entertainment.headline: Producer Naga Vamsi to get Rs 22 crore from YRF after War 2 Telugu losses: ReportYash Raj Films reportedly stepped in to compensate producer Naga Vamsi and partners after the Telugu version of 'War 2' underperformed at the box office. The film features Jr NTR and Hrithik Roshan in lead roles.

Gia Manek marries Varunn Jain in intimate ceremony, calls it a forever unionTelevision actor Gia Manek has married Varunn Jain in an intimate ceremony. The couple shared wedding photos and announced their union on social media.

Hansika Motwani has hilarious reaction to people commenting on her life. WatchHansika Motwani is currently holidaying in Bali with her friend. Amid her divorce rumours, she shared a hilarious video of her reaction to reading comments about her personal life.

Can Ayushmann-Rashmika's Thama redefine vampire tales for Indian audiences?'Thama' is Bollywood's fresh take on vampire lore, blending Indian folklore with gothic romance. Can the film's success reshape Indian horror by localising Western myths authentically? Here's a glimpse at whether Indian audiences may fall in love with vampires the way West has.

KBC 17: Crorepati Aditya Kumar bows out at Rs 7 crore question, settles for 1 croreOn Kaun Banega Crorepati 17, Uttarakhand contestant Aditya Kumar impressed viewers by winning Rs 1 crore after narrowly missing the Rs 7 crore jackpot.

Nick Jonas's bizarre bed habit leaves fans calling him crazyNick Jonas has revealed his strict rule of using the bed only for sleeping, avoiding activities like eating or watching TV, which has surprised many fans. This quirky habit has sparked lively discussions on social media.

Emily in Paris 5: Lily Collins returns with a new adventure in December'Emily in Paris Season 5' explores new cultural landscapes in Italy while maintaining connections to Paris, as Emily faces career challenges and personal growth.

Top films and shows to watch on Netflix this weekendNetflix's new weekend lineup features a mix of romance, thrillers and K-dramas. Here's a glimpse at the new shows and films to add to your binge-list.

Indian remakes of K-dramas, local languages: Korean giant CJ ENM's strategy for IndiaKorean content continues to capture Indian audiences with popular dramas and strategic local remakes. CJ ENM is deepening its presence by partnering with Indian platforms and expanding localisation to strengthen cultural ties.

Samantha on slowing down, new career chapter: Everything I do now matters moreSamantha Ruth Prabhu shifted focus to passion projects, prioritising wellness and quality over quantity. In an interview, she opened up about taking up lesser projects at a time.

Neena Gupta, at 65, owns her shorts look, shuts down troll who body-shamed herActor Neena Gupta clapped back at a troll mocking her airport attire. She was seen wearing a loose t-shirt and shorts for her airport look.

SRK, Gauri step aside as Aryan takes center stage at Bads of Bollywood eventActor Shah Rukh Khan and his producer wife Gauri Khan joined their son Aryan at the preview launch event for 'The Bads of Bollywood'. The upcoming Netflix show marks Aryan's directorial debut.

KJo, Ananya Panday praise Aryan's Bads of Bollywood preview: Absolute blockbusterKaran Johar, Ananya Panday and other Bollywood celebrities reacted to Aryan Khan's Bads of Bollywood preview. Karan and Ananya congratulated Aryan on his directorial.

Samantha opens up on social media pressure and online negativitySamantha Ruth Prabhu shared that while social media bring both praise and trolling, she manages it by staying authentic and taking breaks. The actor also credited the platform for helping her find mentors who positively influenced her life.

Bobby Deol recalls friendship with SRK, says Aryan is all set to conquer the worldBobby Deol spoke about his 30-year-old friendship with Shah Rukh Khan at the 'Bads of Bollywood' preview event. The series will premiere on September 18 on Netflix.

Aryan Khan bows down, gives first public speech at The Bads of Bollywood eventAryan Khan, who has made his directorial debut with 'The Bads of Bollywood', bowed down to the audience and asked for their forgiveness at the launch of the Netflix show. He explained that he was nervous as it was his first time addressing the crowd.

Nandamuri Balakrishna in tears at sister-in-law Padmaja's funeral, video goes viralNandamuri Padmaja, wife of Nandamuri Jayakrishna, died on August 19 in Hyderabad, leaving the Nandamuri family and fans in grief. A video of Balakrishna breaking down while meeting mourners has gone viral.

Ravi Teja's Mass Jathara postponed, producer Naga Vamsi addresses online rumours Ravi Teja's upcoming commercial entertainer 'Mass Jathara', initially scheduled for release on August 27, has been postponed. Producer Naga Vamsi confirmed the delay through a cryptic post on social media.

Aryan Khan just went full throttle: Internet praises The Bads of Bollywood previewAryan Khan's directorial debut, 'The Bads of Bollywood', has garnered positive social media feedback. The series promises a fresh take on Bollywood featuring Lakshya and Sahher Bambba. It also has cameo appearances by Salman Khan, Karan Johar and Ranveer Singh, among others.

general news.headline: Live: PM Modi present in Lok Sabha as proceedings resumeParliament Session Live: After weeks of turmoil and disruptions, the Monsoon Session of Parliament will wrap up today. Congress MPs have again pressed for debate on alleged electoral fraud in both Houses on the last day. On Wednesday, opposition anger peaked in the Lok Sabha when Home Minister Amit Shah introduced three contentious bills mandating the removal of prime ministers, chief ministers and ministers held for 30 days on serious charges. Opposition MPs tore up copies of the draft law, shouted slogans near Shah's seat, alleging that the bills undermine federalism, due process and constitutional principles. Stay with Indiatoday.in for Live Updates.

What happened has happened: Ahmedabad school stabber's chilling chatA Class 10 student of an Ahmedabad school was stabbed to death by his junior after an altercation, with a police probe uncovering a chilling chat.

Doing more should be our mantra: Jaishankar's Russia reachout amid US tariffsS Jaishankar urged Russian firms to step up engagement with India, warning that soaring trade figures mean little unless Moscow opens its market wider to Indian goods.

How Pakistan's Failed Marshal Munir succeeded in wooing TrumpAfter Pakistan's drubbing by India in Op Sindoor, a failed Asim Munir promoted himself to Field Marshal. But the failed marshal succeeded in wooing US President Trump with oil, cryptocurrencies, rare-earth riches, and a Nobel dream, all of which are non-existent. This is how Munir humoured Trump in uniform.

The Real Bengal Files: From Calcutta Killings to Gandhi's MiracleIn the 1940s, Calcutta was torn by communal strife, political rivalry, and Partition's looming shadow. From the Lahore Resolution to the Great Calcutta Killings, the city symbolised India's turmoil — until Gandhi's presence turned it into a rare oasis of peace.

Invited me to hotel: Malayalam actor accuses young Kerala politician of harassmentMalayalam actor Rini Ann George accused a young politician of sending offensive messages. The BJP demanded the resignation of Congress MLA Rahul Mamkootathil, even though the actor did not name anybody in particular.

Why zero GST on insurance premiums doesn't mean cheaper policies for youOn the surface, removing GST on insurance premiums seems like a big relief, but experts caution that the outcome may not be what many are expecting.

First picture of Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta after attack, meets 7 BJP MPsThe first picture of Rekha Gupta emerged a day after she was attacked during a public hearing at her Civil Lines residence. The accused, Rajesh Bhai Khimji, has been sent to a five-day police remand as Delhi Police probe a possible larger conspiracy.

Are engineers taking over India's civil services?Engineers increasingly dominate UPSC civil services recruitment, reducing humanities graduates' presence. This shift raises concerns about losing empathy and diverse perspectives in India's bureaucracy.

As Modi govt tables bills to prevent 'rule from jail', why Opposition smells a ployThe Modi government calls the three bills introduced by home minister Amit Shah as anti-corruption reform while critics allege executive overreach and political misuse

IED blast, the end: Pigeon carrying threat note caught near India-Pak borderSecurity was increased in Jammu after a pigeon carrying an attack threat note was caught near the border. Officials suspect the note could be a prank, raising concerns over border security.

Pixel 10 launched: Top features, key specs, India price, and everything else you need to knowGoogle has taken the wraps off the Pixel 10, the newest member of its flagship smartphone family. Here is a look at the phone's top features, key specs, India price, and everything else.

Banning Online Games: Economic Suicide That Fails to Curb AddictionA blanket ban on real-money gaming harms the economy, pushes users offshore, and ignores proven alternatives. Regulation, not prohibition, is the smart path to protect players and preserve innovation.

Can Sanju Samson do a KL Rahul to stay indispensable in T20Is?Asia Cup 2025: Shubman Gill's return to the T20I fold has complicated matters. Sanju Samson, who had forged a promising opening partnership with Abhishek Sharma, now finds his place under threat. Can the Kerala wicketkeeper-batter adapt, reinvent himself, and make his spot indispensable?

Congress trapped me in fabricated case: Amit Shah defends minister removal billsAmit Shah criticised the Congress for allegedly trapping him in a fabricated case, saying his resignation before arrest and subsequent acquittal illustrated the moral accountability the new bills aim to enforce.

Russia launched 75 mice into space: Here's whyThis experiment is pivotal for deepening our understanding of how spaceflight affects living organisms, and for advancing preparations for human missions to the Moon and Mars.

UP man wanted wife to look like Nora Fatehi, denied her food, caused miscarriageA Ghaziabad woman alleged that her husband forced her to exercise for three hours daily and denied food whenever she failed to comply.

Mahindra XUV 3XO REVX A: First SUV under Rs 12 lakh with Dolby AtmosMahindra has introduced Dolby Atmos in the XUV 3XO REVX A, making it the world's first SUV under Rs 12 lakh to feature immersive cinema-grade audio.

Powdered electrolyte drinks hydrate fast, but are they really safe?Powdered electrolyte drinks, often called 'IV in a bottle,' promise fast and easy hydration. They sound convenient and fancy, but the real question is, do they actually live up to the hype?

Apple to open third India retail store Apple Hebbal Bengaluru on September 2: DetailsApple is set to strengthen its retail presence in India with the launch of a new store in Bengaluru next month. Here are the details.

Losing India would be a strategic disaster in face of China: Nikki Haley to TrumpTensions escalated after President Donald Trump imposed 25 per cent reciprocal tariffs and an additional 25 per cent levy on New Delhi for continuing to buy Russian oil.

FBI arrests Cindy Singh, one of '10 most wanted fugitives' hiding in IndiaThe FBI, working closely with Indian authorities and Interpol, apprehended Singh, FBI Director Kash Patel confirmed. She has been transported back to the United States and will be handed over to Texas officials to face charges.

sports.headline: Ajinkya Rahane steps down as Mumbai captain ahead of new domestic seasonAjinkya Rahane announced on Thursday that he will be stepping down as captain of Mumbai ahead of the upcoming domestic season.

Mohammed Siraj's X-factor will be missed in Asia Cup 2025: Harbhajan SinghHarbhajan Singh feels that Mohammed Siraj should have been included in the Asia Cup squad. The former cricketer thinks that the pacer could have chipped in as the 'x-factor' for India during the upcoming tournament.

BCCI extends Ajit Agarkar's term as men's chief selector till June 2026: ReportBCCI has reportedly extended Ajit Agarkar's tenure as chairman of the senior men's selection committee till June 2026. This move comes after India's strong performances under his leadership, signalling stability amid upcoming cricketing challenges.

Sinquefield Cup: Gukesh held by Sevian, Praggnanandhaa draws with AbdusattorovWorld champion D Gukesh was held to a draw by the lone wild card, Samuel Sevian of the United States, while fellow Indian R Praggnanandhaa also split the points with Nodirbek Abdusattorov of Uzbekistan in the third round of the Sinquefield Cup.

Sara Errani's message after US Open Win: This one is for all doubles playersSara Errani dedicated her US Open mixed doubles win alongside Andrea Vavassori to the doubles specialists who missed out on playing in the tournament. Errani and Vavassori defeated Iga Swiatek and Casper Ruud in the final on Wednesday, August 20.

After Asia Cup snub, Mohammad Rizwan signs for CPL side St Kitts and Nevis PatriotsMohammad Rizwan is reportedly set to join St Kitts & Nevis Patriots for CPL 2025 after missing Pakistan's Asia Cup squad. Rizwan joins a strong Pakistan contingent at this year's CPL.

In the second game, Errani/ Vavassor defeated Collins/Harrison.

Aaditya Thackeray on India vs Pakistan at Asia CupAaditya Thackeray slammed the BCCI for prioritising revenue over national interest by sending India to play Pakistan in the Asia Cup, questioning whether cricketing ties should continue despite terror attacks and ongoing political tensions between the neighbours.

Bring glory back to Chinnaswamy: Venkatesh Prasad promises in KSCA election bidVenkatesh Prasad has pledged to restore Chinnaswamy Stadium's lost glory, promising better safety, more international matches, and smart infrastructure as he enters the KSCA election race with a reform-driven vision for Karnataka cricket's future.

Sara Tendulkar recalls Australia memories, reveals why she never pursued cricketSpeaking exclusively to India Today, Sara Tendulkar opened up about her childhood memories of Australia and her decision not to pursue cricket.

Jack Della Maddalena vs Islam Makhachev: The clash that has UFC fans and fighters talkingIslam Makhachev is moving up to welterweight to challenge Jack Della Maddalena in a high-stakes UFC superfight. Will Makhachev's elite grappling overcome Della Maddalena's knockout power, or will the Aussie striker stop the lightweight king's quest for double-champ glory?

Parliamentary panel calls SAI under-funded, slams India's poor Olympic showA parliamentary panel has slammed low funding and staff shortages at SAI while raising red flags over underutilisation and diversion of funds in the Khelo India scheme, calling India's international sporting performance "far from satisfactory."

Durand Cup: Diamond Harbour stun East Bengal, end dream run in semi-finalEast Bengal's fairy-tale Durand Cup campaign ended in heartbreak as debutants Diamond Harbour FC scripted a stunning 2-1 semi-final upset, with former East Bengal men Mirshad Michu and Joby Justin playing pivotal roles in the shocker.

Vinod Kambli still struggling to speak: Brother shares health updateVinod Kambli's health continues to be a concern as his brother revealed that the former India cricketer still struggles to speak properly while recovering at home, months after being hospitalised for brain clots and urinary infection.

Asia Cup hockey to go on without Pakistan, Rajgir tournament schedule confirmedThe 12th Asia Cup Hockey will be held in Rajgir, Bihar from August 29 to September 7. Pakistan withdrew from the tournament, citing security concerns.

India announce 18-member Men's Hockey squad for Asia Cup 2025 in BiharHockey India announced its 18-member Men's Asia Cup squad, led by Harmanpreet Singh. The team combines experience and balance across all positions, aiming to qualify for the 2026 FIH World Cup in Belgium-Netherlands.

After consulting stint for South Africa, Stuart Broad eyes coaching roleStuart Broad is eyeing a coaching role by 2026, hoping to unearth England's next fast-bowling superstar. He also wants to sharpen his broadcasting skills, drawing inspiration from legends like Ricky Ponting and Ravi Shastri.

Neeraj Chopra skips Brussels leg after Diamond League final qualificationNeeraj Chopra has qualified for the Diamond League Final in Zurich and will skip the Brussels leg, focusing instead on reclaiming the Diamond Trophy before defending his world title at the Championships in Tokyo next month.

Shreyas Iyer's Asia Cup 2025 snub leaves former Indian selector baffledFormer selector Salil Ankola expressed disappointment over Shreyas Iyer's exclusion from the Asia Cup squad. The current chief selector Ajit Agarkar said it wasn't Iyer's fault but explained there was no place for him. Ankola, however, is surprised he wasn't even named in the reserves list.

Shreyas Iyer deserves T20 World Cup spot: Robin Uthappa after Asia Cup snubRobin Uthappa has backed Shreyas Iyer for a T20 World Cup 2026 return after his surprise exclusion from India's Asia Cup squad, calling the omission strange despite Iyer's IPL success and consistent domestic form.

What is IGPL? League that is set to swing a new era for Indian golfThe Indian Golf Premier League is set to change the landscape of the sport in the country. Amateurs and professionals will compete together, giving young talent a stage, bringing excitement to fans, and making the sport visible and inspiring in the country.

Vishwanathan Anand-Kasparov reunion, Gukesh vs Carlsen clash confirmedViswanathan Anand will renew his rivalry with Garry Kasparov in St Louis this October, while world champion D Gukesh takes on Magnus Carlsen in the Clutch Chess exhibition. With USD 412,000 at stake, it's set to be one of the year's biggest events.

Does Shubman Gill's return come at the cost of Sanju Samson's T20I career?Sanju Samson will likely become the sacrificial lamb as selectors bring back Shubman Gill into the T20I fold. With Gill rising as India's next all-format star, Samson's chances of establishing his legacy in T20 internationals look slimmer despite his explosive recent form.

Who is Ashvir Singh Johal? The first Sikh and youngest manager in English footballAshvir Singh Johal has made history as the first Sikh to manage a professional British football club following his appointment at Morecambe. At 30, he also became the youngest manager across the top five tiers of English football.

ICC admits technical glitch after Kohli, Rohit vanish from ODI rankingsRohit Sharma and Virat Kohli disappeared from the ICC ODI rankings. The development comes only a week after they were placed at the 2nd and 4th spot. The disappearance is likely a glitch in the ICC system.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
